intro: Lobelia georgiana f. subhirta, commonly known as the Georgia lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The subspecies subhirta is distinguished by its more densely hairy stems and leaves compared to other forms of Lobelia georgiana.
